item.name: Zabbix DB size
item.params: select SUM(data_length) from information_schema.tables where table_schema = 'zabbix'

macro.description: User pass zbx_probe (cat /root/zbx_probe.pw)
MySQL user pass zbx_probe (cat /root/mysql-zbx_probe.pw)

template.name: Template-Training_App_Apache_Tomcat_JMX
template.description:
The template to monitor Apache Tomcat by Zabbix that work without any external scripts. The metrics are collected by JMX.
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/411862-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-template-tomcat
Template tooling version used: 0.38

item.name: Tomcat: Version
item.description: The version of the Tomcat.

trigger.name: Tomcat: Version has been changed
trigger.description: Tomcat version has changed. Ack to close.

item_prototype.name: {#JMXVALUE}: Gzip compression status
item_prototype.description: Gzip compression status on {#JMXNAME}. Enabling gzip compression may save server bandwidth.

trigger_prototype.name: {#JMXVALUE}: Gzip compression is disabled
trigger_prototype.description: gzip compression is disabled for connector {#JMXVALUE}.

item_prototype.name: {#JMXNAME}: Bytes received per second
item_prototype.description: Bytes received rate by processor {#JMXNAME}

item_prototype.name: {#JMXNAME}: Bytes sent per second
item_prototype.description: Bytes sent rate by processor {#JMXNAME}

item_prototype.name: {#JMXNAME}: Errors per second
item_prototype.description: Error rate of request processor {#JMXNAME}

item_prototype.name: {#JMXNAME}: Requests processing time
item_prototype.description: The total time to process all incoming requests of request processor {#JMXNAME}

item_prototype.name: {#JMXNAME}: Requests per second
item_prototype.description: Rate of requests served by request processor {#JMXNAME}

item_prototype.name: {#JMXHOST}{#JMXCONTEXT}: Sessions active
item_prototype.description: Active sessions of the application.

item_prototype.name: {#JMXHOST}{#JMXCONTEXT}: Sessions allowed maximum
item_prototype.description: The maximum number of active Sessions allowed, or -1 for no limit.

item_prototype.name: {#JMXHOST}{#JMXCONTEXT}: Sessions active maximum so far
item_prototype.description: Maximum number of active sessions so far.

item_prototype.name: {#JMXHOST}{#JMXCONTEXT}: Sessions rejected per second
item_prototype.description: Rate of sessions we rejected due to maxActive being reached.

item_prototype.name: {#JMXHOST}{#JMXCONTEXT}: Sessions created per second
item_prototype.description: Rate of sessions created by this application per second.

item_prototype.name: {#JMXNAME}: Threads count
item_prototype.description: Amount of threads the thread pool has right now, both busy and free.

item_prototype.name: {#JMXNAME}: Threads busy
item_prototype.description: Number of the requests that are being currently handled.

item_prototype.name: {#JMXNAME}: Threads limit
item_prototype.description: Limit of the threads count. When currentThreadsBusy counter reaches the maxThreads limit, no more requests could be handled, and the application chokes.

trigger_prototype.name: {#JMXNAME}: Busy worker threads count are more than {$TOMCAT.THREADS.MAX.PCT:"{#JMXNAME}"}% of the limit for {$TOMCAT.THREADS.MAX.TIME:"{#JMXNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.description: When current threads busy counter reaches the limit, no more requests could be handled, and the application chokes.

macro.description: Filter for discoverable objects. Can be used with following contexts: "GlobalRequestProcessor", "ThreadPool", "Manager"
Filter to exclude discovered objects. Can be used with following contexts: "GlobalRequestProcessor", "ThreadPool", "Manager"
Password for JMX
Threshold for busy worker threads trigger. Can be used with {#JMXNAME} as context.
The time during which the number of busy threads can exceed the threshold. Can be used with {#JMXNAME} as context.
User for JMX

item.name: ClassLoading: Loaded class count
item.description: Displays number of classes that are currently loaded in the Java virtual machine.

item.name: ClassLoading: Total loaded class count
item.description: Displays the total number of classes that have been loaded since the Java virtual machine has started execution.

item.name: ClassLoading: Unloaded class count
item.description: Displays the total number of classes that have been loaded since the Java virtual machine has started execution.

item.name: Compilation: Name of the current JIT compiler
item.description: Displays the total number of classes unloaded since the Java virtual machine has started execution.

item.name: Compilation: Accumulated time spent
item.description: Displays the approximate accumulated elapsed time spent in compilation, in seconds.

item.name: GarbageCollector: Copy number of collections per second
item.description: Displays the total number of collections that have occurred per second.

item.name: GarbageCollector: Copy accumulated time spent in collection
item.description: Displays the approximate accumulated collection elapsed time, in seconds.

item.name: GarbageCollector: MarkSweepCompact number of collections per second
item.description: Displays the total number of collections that have occurred per second.

item.name: GarbageCollector: MarkSweepCompact accumulated time spent in collection
item.description: Displays the approximate accumulated collection elapsed time, in seconds.

item.name: Memory: Heap memory committed
item.description: Current heap memory allocated. This amount of memory is guaranteed for the Java virtual machine to use.

item.name: Memory: Heap memory maximum size
item.description: Maximum amount of heap that can be used for memory management. This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

item.name: Memory: Heap memory used
item.description: Current memory usage outside the heap.

item.name: Memory: Non-Heap memory committed
item.description: Current memory allocated outside the heap. This amount of memory is guaranteed for the Java virtual machine to use.

item.name: Memory: Non-Heap memory used
item.description: Current memory usage outside the heap

item.name: Memory: Object pending finalization count
item.description: The approximate number of objects for which finalization is pending.

item.name: MemoryPool: Code Cache committed
item.description: Current memory allocated

item.name: MemoryPool: CodeCache maximum size
item.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be used for memory management. This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

item.name: MemoryPool: Code Cache used
item.description: Current memory usage

item.name: MemoryPool: Tenured Gen committed
item.description: Current memory allocated

item.name: MemoryPool: Tenured Gen maximum size
item.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be used for memory management. This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

item.name: MemoryPool: Tenured Gen used
item.description: Current memory usage

item.name: OperatingSystem: File descriptors maximum count
item.description: This is the number of file descriptors we can have opened in the same process, as determined by the operating system. You can never have more file descriptors than this number.

item.name: OperatingSystem: File descriptors opened
item.description: This is the number of opened file descriptors at the moment, if this reaches the MaxFileDescriptorCount, the application will throw an IOException: Too many open files. This could mean youre are opening file descriptors and never closing them.

item.name: OperatingSystem: Process CPU Load
item.description: ProcessCpuLoad represents the CPU load in this process.

trigger.name: OperatingSystem: Process CPU Load more than {$JMX.CPU.LOAD.MAX}% for {$JMX.CPU.LOAD.TIME}

item.name: Threading: Daemon thread count
item.description: Number of daemon threads running.

item.name: Threading: Peak thread count
item.description: Maximum number of threads being executed at the same time since the JVM was started or the peak was reset.

item.name: Threading: Thread count
item.description: The number of threads running at the current moment.

item.name: Threading: Total started thread count
item.description: The number of threads started since the JVM was launched.

macro.description: A threshold in percent for CPU utilization trigger.
The time during which the CPU utilization may exceed the threshold.
A threshold in percent for file descriptors count trigger.
The time during which the file descriptors count may exceed the threshold.
A threshold in percent for Heap memory utilization trigger.
The time during which the Heap memory utilization may exceed the threshold.
A threshold in percent for memory pools utilization trigger. Use a context to change the threshold for a specific pool.
The time during which the memory pools utilization may exceed the threshold.
A threshold in percent for Non-heap memory utilization trigger.
The time during which the Non-heap memory utilization may exceed the threshold.

item.name: Zabbix DB size
item.params: select SUM(data_length) from information_schema.tables where table_schema = 'zabbix'

item.name: Zabbix Server - count of unsupported items

macro.description: User pass zbx_probe (cat /root/zbx_probe.pw)
MySQL user pass zbx_probe (cat /root/mysql-zbx_probe.pw)

discovery_rule.name: MySQL slave instance discovery
discovery_rule.description: auto discovery mysql slave instance port

item_prototype.name: MySQL slave seconds behind master
item_prototype.description: The number of seconds that the slave SQL thread is behind processing the master binary log.

trigger.name: Zarizeni je nedostupne po siti
trigger.description: Zarizeni neodpovida na ICMP ping. Overte sitovou dostupnost zarizeni.

trigger.name: Jmeno zarizeni bylo zmeneno
trigger.description: Upozorneni na zmenu SNMP sysName zarizeni.

trigger.name: Zarizeni je nedostupne pro monitoring
trigger.description: SNMP data ze zarizeni nejsou dostupna dele nez 15 minut.

item.name: Registered number of network interfaces
item.description: The number of network interfaces (regardless of their current state) present on this system.

discovery_rule.name: Network interfaces
discovery_rule.description:
You may also consider using {#SNMPVALUE} macro to filter results.
{$SNMP_COMMUNITY} is a global macro.

item_prototype.name: Admin status of $1
item_prototype.description: The desired state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: Description of $1
item_prototype.description: A textual string containing information about the interface. This string should include the name of the manufacturer, the product name and the version of the interface hardware/software.

item_prototype.name: Inbound errors on $1
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

item_prototype.name: Incoming traffic on $1
item_prototype.description: The number of octets in valid MAC frames received on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: Operational status of $1
item_prototype.description: The current operational state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: Outbound discards on $1
item_prototype.description: The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

item_prototype.name: Outbound errors on $1
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that could not be transmitted because of errors.

item_prototype.name: Outgoing traffic on $1
item_prototype.description: The number of octets transmitted in MAC frames on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

trigger.name: GarbageCollector: Mark Sweep Compact in fire fighting mode
Memory: Heap memory usage more than {$JMX.HEAP.USAGE.MAX}% for {$JMX.HEAP.MEM.USAGE.TIME}
MemoryPool: Code Cache memory usage more than {$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"Code Cache"}% for {$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"Code Cache"}
MemoryPool: Tenured Gen memory usage more than {$JMX.MP.USAGE.MAX:"Tenured Gen"}% for {$JMX.MP.USAGE.TIME:"Tenured Gen"}
OperatingSystem: Opened file descriptor count more than {$JMX.FILE.DESCRIPTORS.MAX}% of maximum

graph.name: GarbageCollector: Garbage Collector collections per second
